message:
I need some feedback guys, if there were to be a new tech community with a difference, what would that difference be in your opinion? 

What would you like to see that you are not seeing in current communities?

data.message: To be in Arabic, has a Radio, and chicks, that's all
No Ads pure technical talks ... and always Quality is the king.

articles/posts tagging & better search, most of the time the answer is available but people -myself included- think about the problem & search using wrong keywords or at least not-totally-right keywords

If you want to make offline community make your sessions as workshops to get hand-on real problem not just blah blah blah marketing crap or just simple introduction to one technology I mean take a workshop to learn something that you'll face it in your daily basis work. Most of the sessions I attend in Egypt communities are talking about simple introduction to one technology and not take it in depth and fave a real life problem. And please please make sessions take about Software Engineering Quality like TDD sessions and clean code sessions or may be agile sessions

1- Hackathons
2- Hands-on labs
3- General skills which applies to our career, not just a specific language, e.g. testing, TDD, Front-end engineering, DB administration, even soft skills
4- Applies to the whole programming community, not just .net or Java
5- Mini-talks (5 minutes)
6- Quality video recording of the sessions
Tayseer ++ for the Hackthons and hands-on workshops
I don't understand why in Egypt we Don't have Hacking Communities where we practice Security Issues, Challenges and Hands-on labs
Actually there are, but very few & most of them belong to the Linux community
There is a similar discussion here. Why don't we unify our efforts? http://www.facebook.com/groups/125486020864852/permalink/364725663607552/
Ehm.. I didn't mean anything security-related in specific when I said hackathons. I meant : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hackathon
I know what you mean. but i mean Security :) all the world does Hacking competitions not for the sake of showing of. but for learning, share knowledge and most important decreasing security risks.
